name: Pembroke Hotel

reviews.text: We have just arrived home, all 18 of us, after enjoying a fab 'Spring Saver' at The Pembroke. I have to compliment both Michael & Alan on the lovely rooms which this year had new beds, duvets, a choice of pillows and beautiful linen.
reviews.title: Ten out of ten again!

reviews.text: As usual the food was lovely, especially the steak pie & bread/butter pudding, which went down a treat with the house doubles!!!
reviews.title: The best small hotel in Blackpool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We look forward to our next trip and would recommend The Pembroke to anyone thinking of visiting Blackpool.
reviews.title: yet another brilliant time

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Pembroke a couple of weeks ago. We had stayed there before a few times, and we will certainly be going back again.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel!

reviews.text: Michael and Alan (owners) make you feel so welcome, nothing is too much trouble for them.The hotel lounge is lovely, with a massive flat screen TV and loads of comfy chairs to relax in. We were in bedroom 9, and it was really superb. Very clean, very warm and with every extra you could ever want. The food at the Pembroke is very good. All home cooked and served in a lovely dining room.
reviews.title: Still excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Pembroke Hotel
reviews.title: Outstanding Accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Date 6th October 2007
reviews.title: Been back since 2005
excellent hotel
reviews.text: Reviewer: Visitors to see the lights.

We have just returned from a weekend in Blackpool. The lights were as good if not better than we saw 10 yrs ago. We booked this hotel on line but the choice was superb. The location, amenities and friendliness made the break for us. The accomodation provides everything you want even to the compliementary toothbrush, something we all forget.The breakfast and service was of the highest quality.If you are looking for somewhere to stay in Blackpool this is the place to book.
reviews.title: home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you read my review in 2005 we have been back since and just again for our wedding anniversary 11/8/07.No change at the hotel 5*.Beautiful garden to sit in. Just book it. Price is right. Michael and Alan perfect hosts, Pat 's helping hand a added bonus. Game for a laugh to! Don't be miserable. Enjoy your holiday. There's one thing you won't say on your return home the accommodation was rubbish. Enjoy your holiday. It's up to you!
reviews.title: So bloomin relaxing

reviews.text: Like everyone else, I read the reviews and thought this was too good to be true, but, no, it was simply the best 2 days spent in Blackpool. Michael and Alan were fabulous hosts and our son, Fletcher, who is nearly 4, absolutely loved them, they even went as far as to put a business card in his pocket so that if he got lost then they could be contacted. Michael and Alan have the little touches at the hotel that make it fabulous, my mum was delighted at the luxuries in the room and reminded Michael every meal time that she didn`t even get shower gel in a 5 star Thompson`s hotel never mind the selection they had !!! We had booked for my dad to play the Wurlitzer at the Tower and M & A made us breakfast 15 mins early so we could get there on time, like I say, it`s the little things. I would recommend this hotel to everyone, oh, and the food, it was out of this world !!!! Never change your standards, it was a joy to visit Blackpool and you must stay there as we will not stay anywhere else again !!! Thank you M & A xxx
reviews.title: Simply the best !!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were visiting Blackpool for a wedding, and have to say we were actually dreading it as we had never found any where even vaguely nice to stay on previous visits.
reviews.title: Immaculately clean, good food and very friendly hosts.

reviews.text: Luckily a friend recommended this place, we checked out the reviews on here and thought they were too good to be true.. but they really are true!
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.text: We arrived at the B&B at about 10pm after an horrendous drive up there, and were immediately offered a cup of tea and told to go and sit in the living room and relax whilst our bags were taken to our room.
reviews.title: Exceeding Expectations

reviews.text: Our hosts, Michael and Alan, couldn't be more friendly, it was as if we were visiting friends. They were also always available to give complimentary cups of tea and serve drinks from the bar.
reviews.title: lovely relaxing time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted at the door of the pembroke hotel by one of the owner's, michael. After a very warm welcome we were shown into the lounge and offered a drink. while sitting in the lounge our bags were taken to our rooms for us. Michael then told us a little about the hotel and made sure we were familiar with our location and blackpool in general.
reviews.title: A Little Gem!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very comfortable with everything we needed for a relaxing stay. Breakfast was excellent with a wide variety such as full english, kippers and plenty of cereal and toast with home made marmalades and jams.
reviews.title: best service i've ever had in blackpool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both michael and Alan were always available and very friendly. The whole experience was 1st class and we will definately be going back.
reviews.title: best b&b in blackpol by far

reviews.text: Based on the great holiday we had last year at the Pembroke with two retired Australian friends, eight other friends asked to join my wife and I this year. The unanimous verdict was that the hotel exceeded all expectations in its welcome, food, comfort, service and location.
reviews.title: A great family atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a welcoming tea or coffee on arrival whilst our luggage was taken to our rooms. Each room is packed with thoughtful touches such as the emergency toothbrush and toothpaste, toiletries, eco-friendly kettle and TV/DVD player with access to a DVD and book library. The food is good wholesome home cooking at its very best and Alan's steak pie and bread and butter puddings are to die for! The four-course dinner is excellent value for money, as are the wines and other drinks. Special dietary needs of one of our group were happily and fully catered for.
reviews.title: Great weekend break

reviews.text: Fantastic 5 night break at The Pembroke! We have now enjoyed many stays at this hotel and look forward to many more. Michael and Alan, the perfect hosts, make you feel so welcome. Lovely rooms, superb food and very comfortable surroundings. Well worth the 6 hour drive to get there, to be given 6* treatment!!
reviews.title: Home from home!

reviews.text: A warm welcome on arrival by alan and michael. Nothing is to much trouble, excellent food, can't wait to return!
reviews.title: You tried the rest now try the best(Pembroke).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was lovely and very good value for money, The hosts were fantastic and food was delicious!!!!. Rooms were spacious and very clean with the little extra touches making it more special, Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay

reviews.text: On arrival we were met by micheal and alan who offered us complimentary tea or coffee. in the lounge. then he explained about the rooms , gave us the keys and helped to carry our suitcases to our rooms. the rooms were very clean, and spacious . there was tea, coffee , hot chocolate and horlicks in the rooms and these were replenished daily. The breakfast s and evening meals were lovely, and plenty of food, if you did not like anything on the menu, they would supply what you wanted to eat. nothing was too much trouble for them.and we had a lovely 10 days holiday in Blackpool. THANK YOU MICHEAL AND ALAN AND MICHEALS MUM FOR MAKING OUR HOLIDAY SO ENJOYABLE. WELL WORTH A VISIT. 4 STAR COULD QUITE EASILY BE A 5 STAR. AND WE WILL BE GOING BACK.
reviews.title: excellent value for money

reviews.text: We stayed at the Pembroke again (6th time) Aug 1st - 4th 2010 and every year we say to each other how brilliant it is,but every time it defies logic and gets better,With Michael and Alan once you become friends and they get to know you,the personal touches mean even more..They treat our Son Joey wonderfully making him feel so important,making a quiz about what changed since last year and giving him a prize for each one he got right,they even arranged a specially decorated table for my parents golden wedding anniversary,The food is superb and the service impeccable...If the Pembroke is booked when we want to go to Blackpool,we wont go.
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel Run By The Best There is.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are fantastic with tv/dvd/freeview in all of them. The hotel also has free wireless internet throughout.
reviews.title: Best in thirty seven years

reviews.text: Complimentary products in your room include toothbrush, toothpaste, shaver, foam shower gel ets as well as great selection of the finest teas & coffees.
reviews.title: Excellent Hospitality and Accommodation

reviews.text: Michael & Alan are fantastic hosts they make you feel really at home especially at meal times, also helping at meal times is Pat who also makes you feel really welcome.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

description: 4 Star Silver Award VisitEngland accreditation. Welcome to the Pembroke - a Quality Blackpool Guest House offering you REAL value for money! The Pembroke is an 11 bedded Blackpool Guest House where you will always find a friendly welcome and you may be assured of our very best service and attention at all times. No expense has been spared to offer guests luxurious and spacious en-suite accommodation comprising single, twin, double and family rooms. The peaceful, friendly atmosphere combined with the excellent service make relaxing on a well deserved break a real pleasure. Blackpool Tourism Awards 2004 Hotel of the Year - GOLD WINNER, Blackpool Tourism Awards 2005 Hotel of the Year - GOLD WINNER, Lancashire & Blackpool Tourism Award B&B of the Year 2005/06 - WINNER, Lancashire & Blackpool Tourism Award Best Tourism Website of the Year 2005/06 - WINNER.
